verses.roman:
sabhā-sahite haridāsera paḍilā caraṇe
haridāsa hāsi' kahe madhura-vacane

synonyms: sabhā-sahite—with all the members of the assembly; haridāsera—of Haridāsa Ṭhākura; paḍilā caraṇe—fell down at the lotus feet; haridāsa—Haridāsa Ṭhākura; hāsi'-smiling; kahe—said; madhura-vacane—in a sweet voice.
translation: With all the members of the assembly, the two Majumadāras fell at the lotus feet of Haridāsa Ṭhākura. Haridāsa Ṭhākura was smiling, however, and he spoke in a sweet voice.
